text: I just voted NO on the corporate wishlist that Republicans put on the table today to address the pandemic. Everyday Americans are suffering and this plan puts the needs of corporations over working people. It fails to meet the urgent demands of the moment—we have to do better.
Corporate pork producers are using the coronavirus to push Congress to expedite guest worker visas, even at a time when international travel and immigration is largely shut down. 5/6

Too many federal workers across MA & the US are still being forced to go into work when telework is safer and available. This has to end. The Trump admin must direct agencies to use all telework capabilities NOW. The govt must lead by example, protect families, & #bendthecurve.

Good advice! https://twitter.com/herschelwalker/status/1241822721845211137 QT @HerschelWalker In movie Glory, ⁦@morgan_freeman⁩ stated "sooner or later we're going to have to anty up" so I am here to pitch in! #TogetherApart  ⁦@realDonaldTrump⁩ ⁦@IvankaTrump⁩ ⁦@FitnessGov⁩ ⁦@POTUS⁩ ⁦@FoxNews⁩ ⁦@CNN⁩ ⁦@PHITAmerica⁩ http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1241822661677928454/pu/img/3oNjXJV_0Jp5LUHm.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1241822661677928454/pu/vid/320x568/iW_C4ZnuPolkrUmk.mp4?tag=10

RT @ProtectOurCare While we battle the public health crisis of the Coronavirus and ensure we put #FamiliesFirst, Trump is *still* trying to destroy the Affordable Care Act — and our protections for pre-existing conditions. 

Pass it on. https://twitter.com/teampelosi/status/1241870794000662536 QT @TeamPelosi While we battle the public health crisis of the Coronavirus and ensure we put #FamiliesFirst, Trump is *still* trying to destroy the Affordable Care Act — and our protections for pre-existing conditions. 

Pass it on.

This is a wake-up call: our govt needs to take bold action on a grassroots stimulus for the health experts on the frontlines of this pandemic, & for workers & families who need help now. No more slush funds or no-strings-attached handouts. Real relief for the American people.

Food workers.
Grocery clerks.
Cashiers.
Delivery drivers.
Warehouse stockers.

They were never “unskilled workers.”
They were always essential.

And it’s WAY past time they got the respect they deserve w/ a living wage, paid sick leave, guaranteed healthcare, hazard pay, & more.

Now is not the time to allow large corporations to take advantage of this horrific crisis by profiteering and ripping off U.S. taxpayers.

In the last few days, we’ve seen numerous examples of lobbyists and their agents fighting for special favors.

Here are a few of them. 1/6

This is a critical moment. I saw up close the consequences of what Congress did in 2008. The current Trump proposal is far worse than the worst critique of Bush’s 2008 bank bailout. And it makes no long-term changes to make future bailouts less likely.

As for funds for companies, it’s to keep entities that employ millions of Americans from folding—it’s to save jobs. Keep this up a little longer and we will go from social distancing to social destruction.

Two major economic actions we should take to stabilize working families:

1. Get checks into everyone’s hands NOW. We can tax it back next year from the privileged who don’t need it.

2. Stop the money OUT. Suspend all major bill payments including mortgages, rent, loans, etc. https://twitter.com/cnnpolitics/status/1241738447909502976 QT @CNNPolitics Rep Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez suggests suspending debt and other payments to free up emergency relief funds: "If we're able to get money into households and stop the bleeding with pauses on money going out of households then we can get working families through this thing" #CNNSOTU http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETuKY2BXgAU1JL3.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1241738285560541186/vid/480x270/SdH6eeRi5taVSP_A.mp4?tag=13

Thank you for speaking up and leading, Fran Marion.

You deserve paid sick leave, and any multi-billion dollar corporation telling you they “can’t afford it” is wrong. https://twitter.com/nytopinion/status/1241526757905190913 QT @nytopinion A shift manager at a McDonald’s restaurant in Kansas City, Mo., asks why a company that earned $5.3 billion last year can’t guarantee paid sick leave for all of its workers. https://trib.al/zwTpR8V http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1240674408680886274/img/qc7fPrUqs2kLhEWv.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1240674408680886274/vid/480x270/cfbwusQvKf0EOlNh.mp4?tag=13

Senator Rand Paul has tested positive for COVID-19. He is feeling fine and is in quarantine. He is asymptomatic and was tested out of an abundance of caution due to his extensive travel and events. He was not aware of any direct contact with any infected person.

Community health centers are at the frontlines of this pandemic, providing health care to nearly 30 million low-income people.

Nothing in the Senate has shocked me, until today. Standing in the way of a critically needed rescue package is irresponsible and reckless. Dems say not enough money to states: nearly $200 billion isn’t chump change. Hospitals get at least $75 billion.

As we move forward with a #COVID_19 relief package, the number one concern has to be workers. We should use this moment as an opportunity to reform corporate culture in a way that supports employees—not stock buybacks or higher pay for CEOs. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETugBmZWkAA316e.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1241761421458898944/vid/480x270/eKKz8ipKmj6jTjvq.mp4?tag=13

When workers are laid off, they lose their employer-provided health insurance.

That is why we need a universal, single-payer system that guarantees health care as a right to all our people.

That is why we need Medicare for All.

Now is the time for the Church to show God’s love and help our neighbors in need. https://twitter.com/leestrobel/status/1241579544395550720 QT @LeeStrobel It feels odd to preach to an empty auditorium, as I did last wknd, but God still works thru live streaming. Our church had 49,087 people watching last wknd and 350 salvations. That's just one church. Think what He'll do thru so many other churches during this crisis!

I will vote against a giant slush fund that protects favored corporations and executive paychecks with no meaningful protections for workers. If this isn’t fixed, all Democrats should all stand together and vote no. We maintain our negotiating power when we unite together.

Donald Trump needs to get his act together and do this now. https://twitter.com/NYGovCuomo/status/1241744786366889984 QT @NYGovCuomo I’m calling on the Federal Government to nationalize the medical supply chain.

The Federal Government should immediately use the Defense Production Act to order companies to make gowns, masks and gloves.

Currently, states are competing against other states for supplies.

The health and security of all Americans must be the priority, not coddling CEOs. Democrats must fight for more testing. For hospitals. For workers. For direct relief to families. And for accountability from an administration that has bungled its response from the start.

This is an unprecedented moment and we have got to think in an unprecedented way. Coronavirus has upended daily life for millions of Americans. Many won’t make ends meet at the end of this month. Instead, this bill gives the Trump administration authority to hand out $500B to corporations without any real protection for workers. I will vote no.

We’re weeks past the point that President Trump should be using the Defense Production Act as “leverage” with big companies. Hospitals need ventilators, masks, & other equipment NOW. States are competing to buy medical masks that went from $0.58 to $7 a piece.

We cannot tolerate price-gouging in the middle of this pandemic.

While we battle the public health crisis of the Coronavirus and ensure we put #FamiliesFirst, Trump is *still* trying to destroy the Affordable Care Act — and our protections for pre-existing conditions. 

Pass it on.

Confronting this public health and economic crisis requires a serious bipartisan response. McConnell's draft is anything but that.

It's a corporate wishlist that gives handouts to big businesses and neglects those who require the most help—and need it now. A total nonstarter.

I have called for a grassroots stimulus to actually provide immediate, direct, and sustained relief to families. It has a lot of pieces like paid family leave, student loan debt cancellation, and Social Security benefits. You can read more here: https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/16/opinions/grassroots-stimulus-package-coronavirus-warren/index.html

Really?

That'll last you two or three weeks. What happens after that?

We need to give every person in this country $2,000 a month for the duration of this crisis.
